Ash.Action: Speaks clearly and urgently about the nature of evil, demonstrating awareness and understanding of his situation.
Finds and picks up the Necronomicon, an ancient and dangerous book, indicating curiosity and initiative.
Lops off his own possessed hand to rid himself of evil.
Reads from the book to open a hole in time to send evil back.
Lops off his possessed hand with the chainsaw to stop the evil from spreading.
Reads from the Book of the Dead to open a hole in Time to send the evil back.
Uses a shotgun and chainsaw to arm himself before entering the Time vortex.
Survives a chaotic and violent time vortex journey and crash-lands with his shotgun and car intact.
Screams silently while falling uncontrollably through time, showing vulnerability but no panic or loss of control.
Waves a shaky hand and says 'Take it easy now chief. I don't know how I got here and I'm not lookin' for any trouble.'
Waves a shaky hand and tries to de-escalate the situation by saying he doesn't want trouble despite confusion and fear.
Defends himself aggressively by striking Gold Tooth and kicking Warrior #2 in the face while escaping.
Uses the wooden stock of his shotgun to crack Gold Tooth's jaw, knocking him off his horse.
Leaps atop Gold Tooth's horse and takes control, galloping away.
Kicks Warrior #2 in the face while galloping past, sending him reeling.
Almost thrown from the horse but manages to hang on despite not knowing where the stirrups are.
Glances behind him to assess pursuers and whips his horse to evade.
Defends himself bravely against the Second Horseman, using his chainsaw to knock him off his horse.
Shouts 'No!' when his weapons are taken and he is captured, showing resistance but no indication of friendliness or trustworthiness in this moment.
Is shackled and whipped, showing endurance but no direct interaction with others.
Is shackled, whipped, and dragged as a prisoner, showing no active resistance or attempt to escape.
Responds to Duke Henry's introduction with a sarcastic, dismissive remark.
Looks to the jeering villagers, showing awareness of their hostility but no attempt to engage positively.
Looks to the jeering villagers that surround the pit, wondering what they have in store for him.
Responds confidently and sarcastically to Duke Henry the Red's challenge, undermining his authority.
Watches with disbelief and is frozen in fear as a warrior is thrown into the pit and killed.
Is frozen in fear watching the warrior thrown into the pit and the subsequent terror.
Turns to Arthur and pleads desperately and cowardly to deny knowing the prisoners.
Turns to Arthur and pleads desperately and cowardly to deny knowing him.
Spins to a small sound and looks around cautiously in the pit.
Fails to notice the misty water stirring behind him before the Deadite attacks.
Fights desperately against the Deadite despite being outmatched and injured.
Uses his legs to form a scissor lock around the Deadite's throat and flips the beast despite being attacked.
Tries to hear Wiseman John and squints to discern the object being thrown down to him, showing alertness under pressure.
Cries out in pain after being kneedropped and thrown against the rock wall, showing vulnerability but continuing to fight.
Uses his chainsaw arm to confront and defeat the Deadite, protecting the villagers.
Turns to the crowd after battle, challenges them with a taunt, shoves Gold Tooth to assert dominance.
Commands Henry and his warriors to mount horses and escape, facilitating their freedom despite Arthur's objections.
Uses his shotgun to protect the crowd from the Deadite, demonstrating willingness to defend others.
Addresses the crowd with a confident, somewhat confrontational tone ('This is my boomstick... Next one of you primitives touch me...').
Removes the shotgun from the horse and confidently announces its specifications to intimidate the crowd.
Spots the surviving Second Deadite crawling up from the pit when no one else does.
Shoots twice with the shotgun, cutting the chain and then blowing the Deadite back into the pit, effectively neutralizing the threat.
Twirls the shotgun in a confident, western style manner before holstering it.
Waves away offered fruit with a satisfied burp and drinks wine from a female hand.
Turns away when Sheila touches his hand and tells her to leave him alone after she apologizes.
Responds skeptically but listens to Sheila and the Wisemen about the Necronomicon and the quest.
Waves away offered fruit with a satisfied burp and drinks wine calmly after eating.
Turns away from Sheila's touch and rejects her advances bluntly.
Dismisses the Wisemen's belief that he is the promised one and expresses skepticism.
Asks Wiseman John directly if they can send him back, showing practical focus.
Recognizes the Necronomicon as the cause of his predicament, showing awareness.
Refuses to undertake the quest, saying 'Me? No way, no day. Only place I'm goin' is home.'
Clutches Wiseman John to prevent him from touching the possessed woman, warning 'It's a trick. Get an axe.'
Refuses to undertake the quest for the Necronomicon, saying 'Me? No way, no day. Only place I'm goin' is home.'
Recognizes the possessed woman is faking death and warns others by clutching Wiseman John and saying 'It's a trick. Get an axe.'
Does a flying leap and tackles Sheila, knocking her out of the stone's deadly path.
Does a flying leap and tackles Sheila, knocking her out of the stone's deadly path.
Rolls the Possessed Woman over and into the path of the falling stones, using the environment to neutralize a threat.
Grasps a flaming log with his bare hands and rams it down the possessed woman's throat to save himself and others.
Considers the quest for the Necronomicon after the battle, showing thoughtfulness and responsibility.
Grasps a flaming log with his bare hands and rams it down the monster's oversized throat, choking her and buying time.
Gasps for breath while pinned but still manages to reach for a weapon in a desperate situation.
Considers the offer to quest for the Necronomicon thoughtfully.
Draws Sheila close, wraps her in a cape, and shares a tender kiss with her.
Tightens the tension on the shock absorber springs with a ratchet-like device and tests the spring-driven iron hand successfully, noting it will do nicely.
Wears functional armor and weaponry (iron breastplate, spring-powered iron hand, chainsaw) appropriately while riding into battle, demonstrating preparedness and confidence.
Repeats the magical words seriously and shows determination to complete the task.
Speaks impatiently and somewhat rudely to Wiseman John, saying 'I got it. I got it. I know your damn words. All right?'
Repeats the magical words correctly after being instructed, showing ability to learn and remember important information.
Assertively negotiates terms with Wiseman John, showing confidence and clarity about his goals.
Gallops into the dangerous swirling mist without hesitation, demonstrating decisiveness and courage.
Appears anxious when facing the mist, indicating some uncertainty or nervousness.
Gallops through the mist and rides into the woods, responding quickly to danger.
Hears a woman's soft laughter and looks toward it, showing some attentiveness to others.
Kicks his steed and bolts to escape the evil force, showing self-preservation but no direct interaction with others.
Falls off his horse and groggily stands and stumbles onward, demonstrating persistence but no warmth-related behavior.
Attempts to open the locked shed door by heaving his body against it, showing determination but no warmth indicator.
Whips the horse and gallops into the fog confidently.
Rides slowly and cautiously through the darkening woods, alert to sounds.
Kicks his steed and bolts upon sensing danger, attempting to escape.
Frantically weaves his horse around obstacles skillfully.
Successfully leaps two fallen trees gracefully.
Fails to notice a low branch and is ripped off the horse, falling hard.
Groggily stands and stumbles onward despite injury.
Runs toward a locked shed and tries to force the door open but fails.
Unscrews his iron hand, starts his chainsaw, and attempts to break into the shed to protect himself from the evil force.
Unscrews his iron hand, holsters it, and skillfully starts his chainsaw by threading the starter cord through a slot in his armor, showing mechanical aptitude and quick thinking.
Uses the chainsaw to cut through the log bolt on the door, demonstrating resourcefulness and practical skill.
When the chainsaw dies, he quickly tries to restart it, showing persistence and presence of mind.
Delivers a mighty kick to the door to force entry after the chainsaw fails, showing physical capability and determination.
After tumbling into the shed, he slams the door shut and re-bolts it with the remaining log, demonstrating quick thinking and situational awareness.
Presses himself against the door and prays, showing fear and reliance on hope rather than further action or strategy.
Hugs the door, shaking in silence after a terrifying event.
Braces himself against the door to protect from the Evil Force.
Picks himself up groggy and bruised after being thrown by the Evil Force.
Hugs the door and braces against the Evil Force's attack, showing determination to hold the line despite fear.
Screams when the door frame begins to buckle, indicating a moment of panic or loss of composure.
Is blasted away by the Evil Force and ends up flattened and bruised, suggesting he was overwhelmed and unable to prevent being thrown.
Despite being flattened and bruised, Ash picks himself up groggy but still moving forward, showing resilience and persistence.
Slumps down against a wall to catch his breath, pragmatically decides to rest for the night and get the book in the morning.
Lights a fire to keep warm and huddles near the flame, showing self-care but no direct social warmth.
Fires shotgun at a perceived threat without hesitation, showing caution but not friendliness or trust.
Slumps down against a wall to catch his breath and decides to stay the night in the Mill, planning to get the book in the morning.
Lights a fire using gasoline from his chainsaw and a Zippo lighter to keep warm.
Hears a noise, spins, raises his shotgun, and fires through a window at what turns out to be just a tree branch.
Reloads and cautiously moves to the front door to peer out through a crack after the false alarm.
Calms and pats his terrified horse after it rears up.
Leaps aside just in time to avoid horse's hoofs, calms and secures the horse.
Runs into a mirror, shattering it and injuring himself.
Quickly recovers from running into the mirror and moves to the fireplace to warm up.
Screams in agony and reacts to pain caused by tiny Ashes attacking him.
Heaves a fork at tiny Ash #1 who is running for his life.
Tries to dislodge a bucket from his head and struggles with obstacles set by tiny Ashes.
Accidentally elbows Tiny Ash #2 into the stove's fire, resulting in the tiny man's death, and responds with a casual 'Ooops.'
Rips the bucket from his head and yanks needles from his buttocks, showing quick reaction to discomfort.
Accidentally elbows Tiny Ash #2 into the stove fire, showing clumsiness and lack of control.
Attempts to crush Tiny Ash #3 with his foot but is injured by a rusty nail, indicating a lack of caution.
Dances about hopping on one foot in pain, then stumbles and falls due to obstacles and oil, showing poor balance and situational awareness.
Ends up bound and incapacitated by tiny enemies, indicating failure to maintain control of the situation.
Attempts to vomit out the tiny creature inside him, showing self-preservation and resilience.
Pours scalding hot water down his throat to expel the creature, demonstrating determination and willingness to endure pain.
Laughs after hearing the tiny scream from inside him, indicating a sardonic or tough attitude rather than warmth.
Inhales the living beast whole and tries to vomit it up, showing quick reaction to an unexpected threat.
Pours scalding hot water down his throat to harm the creature inside him, demonstrating resourcefulness and willingness to take action.
Fails to prevent the tiny figure from entering and possessing his iron hand, leading to him being attacked and knocked down.
Is caught off guard and unable to defend himself effectively against the possessed iron hand and mallet attack, ending up groggy and trapped.
Expertly dodges repeated attacks from the Evil Hand despite being trapped and in pain.
Expresses frustration and pain vocally but does not lash out aggressively or cruelly.
Expertly dodges rapid stabs from the Evil Hand using fast finger movements despite being trapped in a vice.
Shakes loose iron pliers clamped on his nose and resists when they clamp down on a back molar.
Jerks his head free from the vice with a scream, regaining control of his iron hand.
Is trapped in a vice and subjected to painful attacks, showing vulnerability but continues to fight back.
Shrieks and flees in horror upon discovering the evil third eye and twin head growing on his shoulder.
Two heads trade insults and physically attack each other.
Shrieks and flees in panic as a monstrous transformation begins on his body, showing loss of control and confusion.
Races through the woods stumbling and acting frenzied, unable to manage the situation calmly or strategically.
Confronts and defeats his evil double decisively to protect himself and others.
Engages in a tense verbal exchange with Evil Ash but maintains composure.
Uses a shotgun to quickly and decisively shoot Evil Ash, effectively neutralizing the threat.
Engages in a tense confrontation with his evil double but maintains control and confidence.
Refuses to bury Evil Ash whole, showing awareness and caution about potential consequences.
Mumbles nervously to the bloody burlap bag while digging a grave for his Evil Twin, asserting personal ownership over one's body.
Faltering momentarily but resolutely lowers the chainsaw to destroy his Evil Twin.
Throws the body of his Evil Twin onto a workbench and secures it with chains before using the chainsaw to dismember it.
Faltering momentarily before lowering the chainsaw to the grisly task.
Drags the bloody burlap bag and digs a grave to bury the remains, showing determination and practical action.
Mumbles nervously to the burlap bag, indicating some internal hesitation or anxiety.
Buries the Evil Ash Head deeply and mutters 'Rest in pieces.'
Buries the Evil Ash Head deeply and marks the grave with a crude burial marker, muttering 'Rest in pieces.'
Moves cautiously toward the cemetery despite harsh weather, showing determination and awareness of danger.
Expresses confusion and frustration about the multiple books, showing openness about his lack of knowledge.
Struggles against the black hole and quickly recovers, showing resilience but no direct warmth-related behavior.
Reaches for the first book without verifying which one is correct, resulting in a dangerous black hole sucking things in.
Quickly pulls free from the black hole's pull and snaps the book shut, recovering from a mistake.
Acknowledges his error with 'Woah. Wrong book.' showing awareness and some humor despite the danger.
Is baffled and unsure about which book to choose, showing hesitation and lack of clear understanding.
Chides himself for being easily duped, then carefully chooses the other book.
Prays for help when attacked by the flying book, showing vulnerability.
Throws the attacking book away to protect himself.
Gently lifts the remaining book despite fear, showing cautious respect.
Encourages himself to say the words aloud despite hesitation and fear.
Chides himself for being easily duped and changes his choice of book.
Is attacked by the flying book and panics, calling for help.
Pulls the attacking book from his face and throws it back to its pedestal.
Slowly and carefully reaches for the remaining book despite fear.
Tries to recite the words from the Book of the Dead, hesitates and muffles the last word.
Calls out the incantation boldly despite uncertainty.
Says 'Hey, wait a minute. Everything's cool! I said the words! I did!'
Says 'I said the words! I did!' showing confidence in his actions despite the ominous situation.
Runs for his horse clutching the Necronomicon, attempting to escape or regroup.
Falls after a skeleton hand grabs his leg, losing control of the situation.
Reaches for the Book of the Dead but is immediately attacked again, showing vulnerability and inability to protect the book.
Is overwhelmed and beaten by multiple skeletal hands and arms, unable to defend himself effectively.
Snarls and aggressively breaks a skeletal arm to escape attack.
Stamps on a skeletal arm to pin it down, breaks the arm in two, and runs away from the attacking limbs, scoops up the Book of the Dead before the skeleton can grab it, and leaps over groping arms.
Is repeatedly punched, slapped, and attacked by skeletal hands, unable to effectively defend himself initially.
Stares in horror at his evil self and flees from danger to protect himself.
Expresses frustration and asserts he has fulfilled his part of the bargain, demanding to be returned.
Kicks the horse and rides off quickly to escape danger, showing quick reaction and decisiveness.
Confidently asserts that he has fulfilled his part of the bargain and expects to be repaid, indicating self-assurance and understanding of the situation.
Whips the horse to ride hard into the darkness, demonstrating determination and control.
Produces the Necronomicon to the Wisemen as promised.
Looks very guilty when the Wiseman reveals the book's power is gone.
Admits to not speaking the exact words when removing the Necronomicon, showing some honesty but also carelessness.
Defends himself by reminding the Wiseman of their deal and their responsibility to fix the problem.
Brings the Necronomicon to the villagers as promised, fulfilling his part of the deal.
Pours water over his head and drinks, showing a casual or distracted attitude in a serious moment.
Admits to not speaking the exact words from the Necronomicon, only 'basically' saying them, which leads to disastrous consequences.
Attempts to remind the Wiseman of the deal and expects them to fix the problem, showing reliance on others rather than taking full responsibility.
Acknowledges he fulfilled his part of the deal straightforwardly without malice.
Looks away, consumed with guilt for dooming Sheila.
Admits he screwed up and apologizes sincerely.
Expresses hopelessness and decides to leave, bowing his head and moving off.
Fulfills his part of the deal by delivering the book as promised.
Expresses guilt and self-doubt, believing he has failed and lacks what it takes to succeed.
Acknowledges failure openly and accepts responsibility for the consequences.
Plants himself between Sheila and the attacking winged Deadite to protect her.
Races to intercept the winged Deadite to protect Sheila, plants himself between her and the beast, and successfully severs the tip of the creature's wing with his sword, causing it to crash.
Shakes his fist and curses as the second winged Deadite escapes with Sheila, showing frustration but no immediate plan to pursue or rescue her.
Encourages the villagers to stand and fight rather than flee, showing determination and leadership.
Dismisses Arthur's concerns and honor code harshly by saying 'Then you'll die. Honor and all.'
Evil Ash strokes Sheila's cheek and caresses her lips despite her revulsion, forcibly embraces and kisses her against her will.
Rides confidently toward the castle despite being outnumbered and intercepted by four horsemen.
Approaches Henry the Red peacefully and explains the threat of the Army of the Dead, seeking help.
Appeals to Henry's sense of obligation by reminding him 'Besides, you owe me.'
States he is only taking the side that will stop the threat, showing practical focus rather than personal grudges.
Persuades Henry the Red to consider joining the fight against the Army of the Dead by presenting logical reasons and appealing to mutual benefit.
Clearly identifies the threat and takes initiative to seek allies, showing strategic thinking.
Does not back down when confronted by armed horsemen, maintaining composure and confidence.
Pours molten iron with the blacksmith to repair the engine, showing cooperation and practical engagement.
Inspects warriors and mocks one by calling him a 'mouse' and insults his village with a derogatory slur.
Works with the blacksmith to repair the Delta 88's engine by pouring molten iron and fashioning rotor blades, showing practical problem-solving and technical skill.
Inspects medieval warriors and confidently asserts authority, demonstrating leadership and confidence.
Creates and successfully fires an improvised explosive arrow using charcoal, cow dung, sulfur, and a fuse, showing ingenuity and skill in weapon-making.
Uses crude and insulting language towards a warrior (calling him 'mouse' and making derogatory remarks about his origin), which may undermine respect and effective leadership.
Scales the ladder to the lookout tower to get a vantage point and assess the approaching threat.
Listens carefully and identifies the sounds of the approaching Deadites before seeing them, showing alertness and situational awareness.
Holds up a finger to signal the archers to wait, timing the attack carefully.
Leads the attack by ordering fire and directing catapults, inspiring warriors who cheer him.
Commands to fire explosive arrows and catapults effectively, coordinates defense against multiple waves of enemies.
Quickly responds to scout's report of a second wave and orders catapults to the south, showing situational awareness.
Slices off the head of Skeleton Captain #1 to assert control and lead the attack.
Confidently commands the new Deadite captain and pushes forward to possess the Necronomicon.
Reassures Arthur that Henry will be here despite the battle's uncertainty.
Slices off the head of Skeleton Captain #1 and immediately appoints a new captain to maintain momentum.
Commands the new captain decisively to ram the gates and push forward.
Calls for arrows to be fired at the defenders, coordinating the attack effectively.
Responds to Arthur's question about Henry with a vague 'He'll be here,' showing uncertainty or lack of concrete information.
Looks terrified, drops his sword, runs and hides during battle.
Looks terrified, turns and runs from the castle entrance, dropping his sword and hiding.
Pilots the Deathcoaster, a steam-powered weapon, to fight off Deadites and protect the villagers.
Pilots the improvised steam-powered Deathcoaster effectively, using it to cut down enemies and turn the tide of battle.
Operates a crude instrument panel with only two levers to steer the craft, managing a bumpy ride but maintaining control.
Blows Evil Sheila off the craft with his shotgun after she attacks him.
Cuts rope to cause boulders to crush attacking deadites, protecting himself.
Spins out his double barreled shotgun and blows Evil Sheila off the craft, effectively neutralizing a threat.
Pulls hard on the steering stick causing it to tear loose, resulting in the Deathcoaster careening out of control and flipping.
Tumbles from the helm and hits the ground but quickly picks himself up, showing resilience.
Races to a set of ropes and pulley, uses his steel hand and sword to slice a rope, triggering a net of boulders that crush two deadites and simultaneously ascends to the parapet.
Fires flame arrows at Evil Ash to stop him, actively fights to protect the Necronomicon.
Watches in horror as Evil Ash burns and transforms, showing emotional reaction.
Engages in intense combat with Evil Ash, demonstrating determination and courage.
Delivers aggressive punches to Skeleton Evil Ash, showing violent combat behavior.
Kicks aside a hay bale, removes a loaded mini-crossbow with flame arrows, and fires accurately to hit Evil Ash, igniting him.
Engages in close combat with Evil Ash, despite being disarmed and forced back, grabs a burning torch to continue fighting.
Loses the torch during the fight, which falls and ignites a fuse leading to black powder on a catapult (potentially dangerous but not directly Ash's fault).
Leaps over a sword swing and side steps a downward strike from Skeleton Ash, showing agility and awareness.
Delivers a powerful punch to Skeleton Ash's head, bursting out its teeth and spinning its head around, demonstrating physical skill and confidence.
Fights bravely against the skeleton and Evil Dead to protect the castle and its defenders.
Seizes the Necronomicon to prevent it from falling into enemy hands, aiding his allies.
After being kicked off the parapet, quickly assesses the situation by noticing the burning fuse and acts decisively.
Grabs a sword from a fallen warrior and skillfully slices the hand holding the Necronomicon in a single motion.
Snags the Necronomicon and cleverly cuts the rope to spring the catapult, using the environment to his advantage.
Reflects respectfully on Arthur despite past problems, acknowledging his goodness.
Observes the funeral pyre with others, sharing a moment of solemnity and respect.
Declines to stay and lead the new nation, citing personal reasons rather than selfish ambition.
Snags the Necronomicon with one hand and slices the rope to spring the catapult, causing the skeleton projectile to be destroyed and the enemy defeated.
Reflects wearily on the battlefield holding the Necronomicon, showing awareness of the consequences of the battle.
Declines the offer to stay and lead as King, choosing instead to move on due to personal reasons.
Accepts the Wiseman's flask and drinks the potion despite skepticism, showing trust in their guidance.
Sets his horse free after dragging the Deathcoaster into the cave, showing consideration and kindness to the animal.
Takes the flask of liquid from Wiseman John and drinks the prescribed six drops despite skepticism, showing willingness to trust and act on limited information.
Drags the Deathcoaster into the cave and sets a powder charge to seal the entrance before entering, demonstrating planning and tactical thinking.
Unknowingly swallows an extra, unintended seventh drop of the sleeping potion, indicating a minor lapse in attention to detail.
Endures a long, harsh sleep and awakens despite extreme physical deterioration and nakedness, then digs to free himself and steps into sunlight.

Falls into a deep slumber and sleeps for centuries, awakening naked and in a heap of rusted scrap, then digs at the rocks blocking the cave's entrance to create an opening and climbs out into the sunlight.
Expresses realization that he has slept too long, indicating awareness of lost time and situation.
Appears stunned and terrified amidst destruction and chaos, screaming in fear.
